intro: Cardanthera difformis, commonly known as the variable sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial species belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. The plant features erect, branching stems and produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of red, pink, and white. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs. Cardanthera difformis thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
